## **Description**
The **Substring **operator allows to extract a string from an input data, based on the configuration settings.

## **Input**
**Input**

**Data type**

**Description**

**in0**

String

The input data from which you want to extract a string

## **Output**
**Output**

**Data type**

**Description**

**out0**

String

The partial string extracted from the input

## **Settings**
**![](data:image/png;base64,)** 

- Select your preferred option for parsing the string:

**From**: position of the character to start parsing the string from. Select the desired position from the corresponding drop-down menu (default value: ***1***, i.e. the first character of the string)

- **Leftmost characters**: start parsing the string from the beginning (i.e. from the first character)

- **Rightmost characters**: start parsing the string from the end (i.e. from the last character)

- In the **Length **field, type the length of the string (i.e. the number of characters) to extract.

- Click **Apply **to confirm.

## **Special cases**
In special cases, the operator behaves as follows:

**Case**

**Behavior**

**NULL input (no input)**

The operator considers a NULL input as an empty string. The system logs a warning event.
